com.phunware.mapping

Class PwMapView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.widget.ImageView
        • uk.co.senab.photoview.PhotoView
          • com.phunware.mapping.PwMapView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, uk.co.senab.photoview.IPhotoView, uk.co.senab.photoview.OnStateChangeListener, uk.co.senab.photoview.PhotoViewAttacher.OnMatrixChangedListener

    public final class PwMapView
extends uk.co.senab.photoview.PhotoView
implements uk.co.senab.photoview.OnStateChangeListener, uk.co.senab.photoview.PhotoViewAttacher.OnMatrixChangedListener

    Designed to display vector based images, or a set of multiple LOD (level of detail) vector images.

    This View can be defined in code or in an xml layout. In either case, nothing will show unless the view has building data set on it. Get data by using PwMappingModule.getBuildingDataByIdInBackground(android.content.Context, long, PwOnBuildingDataListener). Once data is returned it can be set on the view with one of the setMapData(com.phunware.mapping.model.PwBuilding) methods.

    Lifecycle
    Users of this class must forward some life cycle methods from the activity or fragment containing this view to the corresponding methods in this class. In particular the following methods must be forwarded:
    • onCreate(android.app.Activity, android.os.Bundle)
    • onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle)
    • onDestroy(android.app.Activity)
    • onLowMemory()

    Layers
    Layers can be added to the map through addLayer(PwMapViewLayer) and removed with removeLayer(PwMapViewLayer). Predefined layers include PwRouteLayer and PwBlueDotLayer. Custom layers can be added by using extending PwMapViewLayer. Some lifecycle events are forwarded to layers however currently the only way to restore state is by making sure layers are added again after calling onCreate(android.app.Activity, android.os.Bundle); in onDestroy(android.app.Activity) layers are asked to save state and are then removed from the view.

    Touch Listeners
    If you wish to set a touch listener on the map view use setOnMapTouchListener(android.view.View.OnTouchListener) instead.

    Callback Events
    This view provides the option to set callbacks for certain events.

    • setOnMapViewStateChangedListener(PwOnMapViewStateChangedListener) signals when the view has changed floors or zoom levels.
    • setOnPOIClickListener(PwOnPOIClickListener) is called any time a point of interest is clicked.
    • setOnMapLoadCompleteListener(PwOnMapLoadCompleteListener) is called once the first image has loaded and is drawn.

        floorId - floor id to display

      • getCurrentFloorLevel

        public int getCurrentFloorLevel()
        Get the physical level of the current floor. For example, 4th floor, 23rd floor, etc.
        Returns:
        A current floor value, or -1 for no current floor.

      • getCurrentFloorIndex

        public int getCurrentFloorIndex()
        Get the index of the current floor.
        Returns:
        current floor index.

      • getCurrentFloorId

        public long getCurrentFloorId()
        Get the ID of the current floor.
        Returns:
        Current floor's ID. -1 is returned if there is no current floor.

      • getCurrentFloorName

        public java.lang.String getCurrentFloorName()
        Get the name for the current floor.
        Returns:
        PwFloor name, or null if there isn't any data.

      • setCurrentFloorByIndex

        public int setCurrentFloorByIndex(int floorIndex)
        Set the current floor by its index. This will not throw an index out of bounds exception. Instead, if the specified floor index is below 0 then the index to change to will instead be 0. If the specified floor index is greater than the last floor index then the index to change to will be that index. If the index is the same as the current index then nothing happens. This should only be used once the map data is ready. Otherwise this will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        floorIndex - The index to set the current floor to.
        Returns:
        The new current floor index, or -1 if the index can't be set.

      • setCurrentFloorById

        public void setCurrentFloorById(long floorId)
        Set the current floor by its Id. Instead, if the specified floor level is below the lowest floor then the floor will change to the lowest floor. If the specified floor level is greater than the highest floor then the floor will change to the highest floor. If the level is the same as the current level then nothing happens. This should only be used once the map data is ready. Otherwise this will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        floorId - The id to change the current floor to.

      • onZoomLevelChange

        public void onZoomLevelChange(int oldZoomLevel,
                     int newZoomLevel)
        Specified by:
        onZoomLevelChange in interface uk.co.senab.photoview.OnStateChangeListener

      • setCenterPoint

        public void setCenterPoint(float x,
                  float y)
        Change the center point of the image. When methods are called to center the map or to center a POI for example, this center point will be used. Use clearCenterPoint() to revert back to the actual center point.
        Parameters:
        x - Center x.
        y - Center y.

      • clearCenterPoint

        public void clearCenterPoint()
        Clear a center point defined in setCenterPoint(float, float). This will revert back to the actual center point.

      • centerToPointInMSE

        public void centerToPointInMSE(android.graphics.PointF msePoint,
                      PwCoordinateSpace coordinateSpace,
                      int zoomLevel)
        Center to a point that is in a MSE coordinate space at a specified zoom level. Centering will move as far as possible without moving the map out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        msePoint - A point in the MSE Coordinate space
        coordinateSpace - An MSE Coordinate Space
        zoomLevel - the Zoom level to go to.

      • centerToPointInMSE

        public void centerToPointInMSE(android.graphics.PointF msePoint,
                      PwCoordinateSpace coordinateSpace)
        Center to a point that is in a MSE coordinate space while staying at the current zoom level. Centering will move as far as possible without moving the map out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        msePoint - A point in the MSE Coordinate space
        coordinateSpace - An MSE Coordinate Space

      • center

        public void center()
        Center the map to the view while staying at the current zoom level.

      • center

        public void center(int zoomLevel)
        Center the map to the view at a specified zoom level.
        Parameters:
        zoomLevel - the Zoom level to go to.

      • centerToPOI

        public void centerToPOI(PwPoint poi)
        Center to a POI.
        Parameters:
        poi - POI to center to

      • centerToPOI

        public void centerToPOI(PwPoint poi,
               int zoomLevel)
        Center to a POI at a specified zoom level. Centering will move as far as possible without moving the map out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        poi - POI to center to
        zoomLevel - the Zoom level to go to.

      • centerToPointInMap

        public void centerToPointInMap(android.graphics.PointF mapPoint,
                      int zoomLevel)
        Center to a point that is in the map coordinates, converted from MSE Coordinates. Centering will move as far as possible without moving the map out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        mapPoint - a point on the map. This should be a point that was converted from MSE Coordinates.
        zoomLevel - the Zoom level to go to.

      • centerToPointInMap

        public void centerToPointInMap(android.graphics.PointF mapPoint)
        Center to a point that is in the map coordinates, converted from MSE Coordinates. This will center to the point while staying at the current zoom level. Centering will move as far as possible without moving the map out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        mapPoint - a point on the map. This should be a point that was converted from MSE Coordinates.

      • setIgnoreBounds

        public void setIgnoreBounds(boolean ignore)
        Set to true if bounds should be ignored or false to recognize them. This will also prevent the map from panning or zooming by touch`
        Parameters:
        ignore - True to ignore, false to recognize.

      • isIgnoreBounds

        public boolean isIgnoreBounds()
        Check if bounds should be ignored or not.
        Returns:
        True for ignore, false for recognize.

      • goUpOneFloor

        public int goUpOneFloor()
        Go up one floor. Example, if the current floor is 1, the this will go to floor 2. This should only be used once the map data is ready. Otherwise this will do nothing.
        Returns:
        The index of the new floor. If there is no next floor then -1 is returned.

      • goDownOneFloor

        public int goDownOneFloor()
        Go down one floor. Example, if the current floor is 3, this will go to floor 2. This should only be used once the map data is ready. Otherwise this will do nothing.
        Returns:
        The index of the new floor. If there is no previous floor then -1 is returned.

      • getNextFloorIndex

        public int getNextFloorIndex()
        Get the index of the next floor that is available to display. This should only be used once the map data is ready. Otherwise this will return -1.
        Returns:
        the next floor's index or -1 if it is out of range or the map data hasn't been loaded yet.

      • getPreviousFloorIndex

        public int getPreviousFloorIndex()
        Get the index of the previous floor that is available to display. This should only be used once the map data is ready. Otherwise this will return -1.
        Returns:
        the previous floor's index or -1 if it is out of range or the map data hasn't been loaded yet.

      • resetCurrentFloor

        public void resetCurrentFloor()
        Use this to reset the positing and scale of the current floor's image.

      • addLayer

        public void addLayer(PwMapViewLayer layer)
        Add a layer to the map view to be drawn on top of the map. This will invalidate the view. If the layer has already been added then nothing happens. This will make sure that this map's Point Of Interest layer is always at the top (displayed on top of everything else).
        Parameters:
        layer - Layer to add.

      • removeLayer

        public boolean removeLayer(PwMapViewLayer layer)
        Remove a layer from the map view. This will cause the view to be invalidated and it will re-draw. If the layer was never added then nothing happens and false is returned.
        Parameters:
        layer - Layer to remove
        Returns:
        True if the layer was removed, false if not.

      • setOnPOIClickListener

        public void setOnPOIClickListener(PwOnPOIClickListener l)
        Set a callback to the POI
        Parameters:
        l - Callback listener

      • removeOnPOIClickListener

        public void removeOnPOIClickListener()
        Remove a listener from the POI layer.
